properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 2 at 2:37PM MST until February 4 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH
MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL THROUGH SOUTH CENTRAL WYOMING...

* WHAT...Periods of snow expected. Snow may be moderate to heavy
at times with areas of freezing drizzle. Total snow
accumulations of 4 to 7 inches.

* WHERE...Central Laramie County.

* WHEN...From 5 PM Monday to 5 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening
commutes.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow and ice
are expected or occurring. Gusty winds are also possible. This
will make travel dangerous.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY
